721680f-b.text:
(1)
Monroe Street, east from but not including Pike Street, showing
an exclusive view of the north side of the street.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NEG. # 4542
(2)
Photo No. 2 shows an exclusive view of the south side of the street extending to Rutgers Street. Note the demolition work on No. 87, a
4-story house.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
721680f-b.folder: Monroe Street & Pike Street, Manhattan, NY

721680f-a.folder: Monroe Street & Pike Street, Manhattan, NY

721678f-a.text:
76 (partially shown), and 78 Monroe Street, west of and adjoining the S.W. corner of Pike Street. (No. 78 is a stable, seen being demolished). The corner appears as a clearance created by the demolition of a 1-story
frame and a 3-story brick building.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
721678f-a.folder: Monroe Street & Pike Street, Manhattan, NY

721679f-a.text:
77 Monroe Street, at the N.W. corner of Pike Street.  Partially shown on the extreme right is No. 54 Pike Street, 5-story tenement that adjoins the corner.
July 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
721679f-a.folder: Monroe Street & Pike Street, Manhattan, NY
